conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on each object and determine the equilibrium state of the system.

Object A with mass 2m is connected to object B with mass 3m on the ground via a light spring with a spring constant k. An inextensible light rope passes over a fixed pulley, with one end connected to object A and the other end connected to an object C with mass m.
Objects A, B, and C are all in a state of rest. The gravitational acceleration is g, and all friction is neglected.
Change the mass of object C to 5m. At this point, C slowly descends, and after some time, the system reaches a new equilibrium state.
At this time, B still does not leave the ground, and C is only subjected to gravity and the tension of the rope.
Identify the forces acting on each object.
Object A: The spring is in tension, and the rope is pulling on it.
Object B: The rope is pulling on it.
Object C: The tension in the rope is pulling on it.

premise: The system is in equilibrium when the net force acting on each object is zero.
conclusion: The net force on object A is the tension in the spring minus the weight of object A.

premise: The system is in equilibrium when the net force acting on each object is zero.
conclusion: The net force on object B is the tension in the rope minus the weight of object B.

premise: The system is in equilibrium when the net force acting on each object is zero.
conclusion: The net force on object C is the tension in the rope minus the weight of object C.
Calculate the tension in the spring.

premise: The tension in the spring is given by the force equation: T = kx, where k is the spring constant and x is the displacement of the spring.
conclusion: The displacement of the spring is x = 2m/k.

premise: The displacement of the spring is x = 2m/k.
conclusion: The tension in the spring is T = k * (2m/k) = 2m.
Calculate the tension in the rope.
